thread.title: Beaverton police seeking hit-and-run driver who struck police SUV
thread.title_full: Beaverton police seeking hit-and-run driver who struck police SUV | OregonLive.com

author: Betsy Hammond | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Beaverton police seeking hit-and-run driver who struck police SUV
text:
Police are looking for a car and driver that crashed into a Beaverton Police SUV shortly after midnight Saturday morning, then fled south into Beaverton.
The officer driving the SUV was injured badly enough to need treatment at Providence St. Vincent Medical Center, officials said. He has been released.
The crash occurred when a driver heading west on Canyon Road just past Oregon 217 turned left into the police SUV traveling east on Canyon Road. The police officer had a green light and the car that hit the SUV had a flashing yellow left turn arrow, Beaverton police say.
The car is described as a dark Honda Accord with extensive front end damage, which could include broken or missing headlights. It may have flames painted on its side.
The Honda fled south and was last seen heading west on Southwest Farmington Road, police say. The vehicle and driver have not yet been located.
The Washington County Sheriff's Office is leading the investigation and anyone with information is asked to call (503) 629-0111.
-- Betsy Hammond
betsyhammond@oregonian.com
